name: silicon production, solar grade, modified Siemens process | silicon, solar grade | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7847/documentation

This dataset represents the production of solar-grade silicon for use in the photovoltaic industry. For this use, a purity of >98% is sufficient. The process modeled in this dataset represents a mix of the Siemens process (used for the production of electronic-grade silicon) and a modified Siemens process (developed specifically for the production of solar-grade silicon), with each process having a 50% share. The inventory is based on literature and industry data.;References:;Jungbluth N., Stucki M, and Frischknecht R. (2009) Photovoltaics. In Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. ecoinvent report No. 6-XII, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH, 2009.

The activity starts when the raw materials enter the process.

This activity ends with the production of high purity polycrystalline silicon from MG-silicon. Only energy use, chemicals and yield are known. Emissions to water are roughly estimated.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for different types of processes in Europe and North America. The inventory is assumed to be representative of the global production.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Production with the Siemens process either from SiHCl3 or SiH4. Partly with standard the Siemens process and partly with the modified Siemens ('solar grade') process, which has a lower electricity consumption. The mix of electricity supply is in accordance with the actual conditions at the considered production locations. ;Reference:;Jungbluth N., Stucki M, and Frischknecht R. (2009) Photovoltaics. In Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. ecoinvent report No. 6-XII, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH, 2009.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Emissions to water are estimated with values taken from the MG-silicon purification to EG-silicon with a similar type of process. This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Average of data from one company and estimated data from another company based on literature data.

exchanges.description:
Solar grade silicon finds application in the photovoltaic industry.

References:
Jungbluth N., Stucki M, and Frischknecht R. (2009) Photovoltaics. In Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. ecoinvent report No. 6-XII, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH, 2009.
